intro: Bauhinia parvula, commonly known as the small bauhinia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinnate leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. Bauhinia parvula is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in tropical climates. It also has the potential to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
